body.p:
I recd your Sundry
forms 2d March 2d May and 31 Aug together with all the missing
Occidents and a letter from Mr I J Seixas explaining the detentions of
these letters and books having been occassined by the negligence
of your New York Agent, which I regret as it has been the
cause of my losing many Subscribers, I was reduced to 5
but since the books have arrived I have got 2 more thus
nowI have 7 Subscribers, in my last I informed you
of having disposed of One Sett of prayer Books since which
tho we have passed all the Hollidays which in the time to
sell I have not been able to ? of a single sett. They
all complain the Books are too large & heavy so much so
that I have orders for three setts of printed on thin paper
like your daily services, and as they fear you will not have
them bound as they wish, that is to say One of the ?, he
requests you will send him out, an unbound Sett if on thin
paper, his object is to cut off the margins as much as possible

and then have them bound in smaller vols. according to his
own taste, they being for a very young lady who could not
well hold one of these books in her hands the time she should,
in consequence of the weight, the other two setts you will
please send according to the order enclosed, all three setts
are bespoken consequently they must be according to order
and those you cant fulfill (if any) according to the order do
not send at all, as I am assured to receive them on my
hands, you would do well also to print up a few setts more
for me to sell with at least the Kee?m books divided,
in two or three and all the always on thin paper, as these
heavy Books will not sell, the West India ladies will
not use them the English addit? being, so much
smaller or lighter.

I am very much obliged to you for the notice you took
of my dear wifes death, the centiments of pref?d being
your own I am doubly thankful

I would surmise on the price of the Books you charge them
5 ? over your price as here 5 franc peices pass for dollars
and if you require remittince in that sp? you will have
to loose the diffre, however do not mention any thing of
that in your letter as I may prehaps have to show
it to them—

in your kind form of 2d May I? recive? with much pleasure your
promise to send my sister Mrs. Luiso a number of the Occidents
I have written her to that effect and have requested her to apply
to your Agent in London if she does not hear from them—
with the sett of prayer Books herein order to be sent unbound
please send (on same s? paper and same size) a sett
of Pentatuch unbound as the persons whiles wishes? to have
them forming one complete sett, all bound alike and all
printed as he likes, I will copy below this the order he
has given me in his own words to avoid mistakes—

hoping you have passed pleasantly the
hollidays and that you may see many happy
returns of them I am Your Sincere friend &c &c

in your form of 2d March you say “The books ordered by P? Cabello
will go by the next Packet, ? I do not Re? having order any
books by P? Cabello or any where ? if you have ? any ?
let me know.—

One sett of prayer books
One Ditto Pentatuche}

all printed on thin paper to be
unbound, the persons wants to get
them bound here that he may divide
them to his liking and his motive for
?ing thin paper is because he wants them
for his young daughter consequently wants
them light if this cant be sent according
to his desire do not send them—
